explanations.machine learning: The paper explicitly mentions the use of machine learning techniques to identify predictors of life insurance demand.
explanations.supervised learning: The techniques used (neural networks, SVM, Gradient Boosting, logistic regression) are all supervised learning methods, as they involve training on labeled data to predict outcomes.
explanations.classification: The study involves predicting life insurance ownership, which is a binary classification problem (owning or not owning life insurance).
explanations.regression: Logistic regression is mentioned as one of the techniques used, which is a type of regression analysis for binary outcomes.
explanations.support vector machine: The paper specifically mentions the use of Support Vector Machine (SVM) modeling as one of the machine learning techniques employed.
explanations.SVM: This is an abbreviation for Support Vector Machine, which is explicitly mentioned in the abstract.
explanations.neural network: The abstract states that neural networks were one of the machine learning techniques used in the study.
